titleStmt.title: State of Indiana v. James A. Clemmons, Indictment
CWG7735

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1862-1863

body.p:
The State of Indiana
Johnson County } ss.
In the Johnson Circuit Court March Term 1863

The State of Indiana
vs
James A Clemmons

The Grand Jurors of the state of Indiana empanneled sworn and charged to enquire of feloniousies & offenses committed within Johnson County, upon their oath present charge and find That James A Clemmons on the 26" day of January 1863 at and in the said county of Johnson and the state of Indiana and within the Jurisdiction of this court, did feloniously purposely and with premeditated malice unlawfully kill and murder Beverly J. Dickerson by then and there shooting the said Beverly J. Dickerson with a gun wadded with powder and leaden balls contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the state of Indiana.

William W Leathers
Prosecuting Attorney
And upon the back of said Indictment the following endorsement appears to wit
Secretary of State

Johnson C. C.
State of Indiana
vs.
James A Clemmons
In the Johnson Circuit Court the State of Indiana vs James A Clemmons, Indictment for murder -- a true bill James M. Kelly Foreman of the Grand Jury.

Witness for the State
Henry Whitesides John W. Kightley David Alexander Benjamin Davis A J Tucker Susan Eddy. Belle Eddy. Ann Terhune Margaret Bowen Ann Farly Caroline Bowen Nancy Hill Nancy Danshul Patrick McMarrel John Bowen sen Louisa Gatewood Rob T Jeffry John High Jacob Aton Dr Payne Dr Hall & Dr Jones. The indictment was filed in my office March "11" 1863.
Barnett clk.

State of Indiana
Johnson County } ss

I W H Barnett Clerk of the Johnson Circuit Court in and for the County and state aforesaid do hereby certify the within and foregoing is a true copy of the Indictment wherein the state of Indiana is plaintiff and James A Clemmons is defendant as now is on file in my office.
In testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and the seal of said Franklin March 12" 1863
William H. Barnett clk

I, William W. Leathers Prosecuting Attoney, within and for the 5th Judicial Circuit, in the State of Indiana, do hereby certify that I am informed and believe that James A. Clemmons is a futitive from justice from the state of Indiana, and has escaped into the State of Kentucky,
I therefore recommend that a requisition be made upon the Governor of the State of Kentucky for the said James A. Clemmons,
This the 12" day of March 1863

William W. Leathers
Prosecuting Atty
5" Judicial Circuit

The Secretary of State will please make out proper requisition for the arrest of James A. Clemmons upon the Governor of Kentucky, requesting that the warrant be delivered to Richard Dickerson.
Indpls. Mch 12 1863.

O. P. Morton
Governor of Inda
